pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.4: The section on where it was laid down
pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.9:1.1: (1) “The offense entailing expulsion for having sexual intercourse was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.1: “The offense entailing expulsion for having sexual intercourse that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.6: How Sudinna had sexual intercourse with his former wife.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.8: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.13: That the monks and nuns have in common.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.16: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.20: “What kind of failure is it among the four kinds of failure?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.22: “What class of offense is it in among the seven classes of offenses?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.23: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origination of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.26: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:3.4: these were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.1: These great beings of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.2: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.3: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.4: On the island of Sri Lanka.”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.1: (2) “The offense entailing expulsion for stealing that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.6: How Dhaniya stole timber belonging to the king.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.1: (3) “The offense entailing expulsion for intentionally killing a human being—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.6: How those monks killed one another.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.1: (4) “The offense entailing expulsion for claiming a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality —where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.4: The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.6: How those monks praised one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:9.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.1: (1) “The offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened On. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.1: “The offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.6: How Seyyasaka emitted semen with his hand.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.8: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.13: That the monks and nuns do not have in common.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.16: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.20: “What kind of failure is it among the four kinds of failure?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.22: “What class of offense is it in among the seven classes of offenses?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.23: The class of offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origination of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.26: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:12.4: these were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.1: These mighty beings of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.2: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.3: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.4: On the island of Sri Lanka.”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.1: (2) “The offense entailing suspension for making physical contact with a woman—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.6: How Udāyī made physical contact with a woman.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.9: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.1: (3) “The offense entailing suspension for speaking indecently to a woman—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.6: How Udāyī spoke indecently to a woman.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.1: (4) “The offense entailing suspension for encouraging a woman to satisfy one’s own desires—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.6: How Udāyī encouraged a woman to satisfy his own desires.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.1: (5) “The offense entailing suspension for acting as a matchmaker—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.6: How Udāyī acted as a matchmaker.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in six ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.9: from body, not from speech or mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.10: from speech, not from body or mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.11: from body and speech, not from mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.12: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.13: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.1: (6) “The offense entailing suspension for having a hut built by means of begging—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.6: How those monks had huts made by means of begging.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.1: (7) “The offense entailing suspension for having a large dwelling built—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.6: How Channa had a tree that served as a shrine felled to clear a site for a dwelling.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.1: (8) “The offense entailing suspension for groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.6: How those monks groundlessly charged Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.1: (9) “The offense entailing suspension for charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.6: How those monks charged Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in three ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.1: (10) “The offense entailing suspension for a monk not stopping to pursue schism in the Sangha when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.6: How Devadatta pursued schism in a united Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.1: (11) “The offense entailing suspension for monks not stopping to side with one who is pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.6: How those monks sided with and supported Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.1: (12) “The offense entailing suspension for a monk not stopping to be difficult to correct when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.6: How Channa made himself incorrigible when legitimately spoken to by the monks.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.1: (13) “The offense entailing suspension for a monk not stopping to be a corrupter of families when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.6: How those monks, when the Sangha did a legal procedure of banishment against them, slandered the monks as acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.1: (75) “The offense of wrong conduct for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.4: The monks from the group of six.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.6: On the subject of the group of six monks easing themselves and spitting in water.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.7: One laying down, one supplementary laying down.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.8: Of the six origins of offences he originates it by one origin:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.9: he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech. [75]
pli-tv-pvr1.9:28.1: Concluded is the Chapter on Laying-Down-Where
